prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Curved Side Step 1: Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. This sketch will form the profile of the rectangular prism with a curved side. Step 3: Draw the lines for the rectangle 1. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.0003, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line from point [0.0003, 0.0] to point [0.0003, 0.1252]. 3. Draw a line from point [0.0003, 0.1252] to point [0.0, 0.1252]. 4. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.1252] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Step 4: Draw the curved side of the rectangle Draw an arc that connects the end points of line_1 and line_3, with a center point at the midpoint of line_2. The radius should be the distance between the center point and the end point of line_2. Step 5: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1252. Step 6: Transform the scaled 2D sketch to 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] Step 7: Extrude the 3D model Extrude the 3D sketch to a depth of 0.1875 in both directions of the normal. This will create the final shape of the rectangular prism with a curved side. Final Shape The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered in the image.</description>

Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the following euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.4075, 0.0] Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.4075 towards the normal direction, and no depth in the opposite direction. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Create a new coordinate system at the following location and rotation. Note the relationship between the first part's Translation Vector and this coordinate system's Translation Vector (i.e., they share the same Y value at 0.4075). * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.3538, 0.0, 0.3221] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane, constrained by the new coordinate system, containing a single rectangular face. The face has a loop, which in turn has four lines: 1. Line 1 starts at (0.0, 0.0) and ends at (0.3962, 0.0). 2. Line 2 starts at (0.3962, 0.0) and ends at (0.3962, 0.3871). 3. Line 3 starts at (0.3962, 0.3871) and ends at (0.0, 0.3871). 4. Line 4 starts at (0.0, 0.3871) and ends at (0.0, 0.0). Scale the 2D sketch using a factor of 0.3962. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the following euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.3538, 0.0, 0.3221] Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with no depth (0.0) towards the normal direction and 0.1019 depth in the opposite direction. This process generates two intermediate parts of a final three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, parallel sides, and straight edges. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units.</description>
